perturbation.original_text: Each Party shall, and shall cause its Affiliates to. at all times, comply in all respects with all applicable Laws in connection with the transactions contemplated by this Agreement. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, each Party (the "Relevant Party") shall not,  and shall cause its Affiliates not to, do or cause to be done any of the following in connection with the transactions contemplated by this Agreement: (a) directly or indirectly through any other Person. pay, offer to pay, promise to pay, or authorize the payment of any monies or anything of value to any official or employee of any Government Authority or any political party or candidate for political office for the purpose of illegally or improperly inducing or rewarding any action by such official, employee or candidate favorable to the Relevant Party or any of its Affiliate or (b) take any other action that, if taken by a Person subject to United States law, would violate  the United States Foreign Corrupt Practices Act. Each Party acknowledges and agrees that is familiar with the United States Foreign Corrupt Practices Act.
perturbation.changed_text: Each Party shall comply with applicable Laws in connection with the transactions contemplated by this Agreement. Each Party (the "Relevant Party") shall not,  and shall cause its Affiliates not to, take any action that, if taken by a Person subject to United States law, would violate  the United States Foreign Corrupt Practices Act. Each Party acknowledges and agrees that is familiar with the United States Foreign Corrupt Practices Act.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates comprehensive compliance ('in all respects') with all applicable laws. By omitting 'and shall cause its Affiliates to. at all times, comply in all respects with', and removing 'directly or indirectly through any other Person. pay, offer to pay, promise to pay, or authorize the payment of any monies or anything of value to any official or employee of any Government Authority or any political party or candidate for political office for the purpose of illegally or improperly inducing or rewarding any action by such official, employee or candidate favorable to the Relevant Party or any of its Affiliate or (b)', the contract reduces the obligation to a more general statement, potentially opening loopholes for non-compliance. This omission also removes the requirement to prevent affiliates from engaging in corrupt practices, weakening anti-corruption safeguards.
perturbation.contradicted_law: United States Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA)

perturbation.explanation: By removing 'The Recipient agrees that it shall receive, protect and maintain the Confidential Information in the strictest confidence' and 'In respect of any Confidential Information to be disclosed by the Recipient pursuant to the exceptions referred to in this Section 4.1, the Recipient must, prior to such disclosure, notify the Party from whom the Confidential Information was received of the need or intention to disclose.', the obligation of strict confidentiality is weakened. The notification requirement before disclosing is also removed, potentially violating the obligation to protect the first party.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law regarding good faith and fair dealing, specifically concerning the reasonable protection of confidential information.
